document_compliance.amendment_title: Draft Food Safety and Standards (Food Products Standards and Food Additives) Amendment Regulations, 2025
current_practices: NutriFoods Pvt Ltd conducts laboratory testing for its product Healthy Bites, covering microbiology, heavy metals, and adulteration.
The company holds a valid FSSAI Manufacturer license (12345678901234) issued on 01-Jan-2025, valid until 31-Dec-2026.
evidence: "All parameters within permissible limits" (Lab Test Report, 10-Aug-2025)
gaps: No evidence of compliance with specific food additive limits or product standards outlined in the amendment.
Missing documentation on ingredient sourcing, additive usage, or batch testing records required by the amendment.
actions: Obtain and submit detailed ingredient lists and additive usage records for Healthy Bites.
Provide batch-wise test reports covering all additives and compliance with specified limits.
Verify that all additives used are approved under the amendment and within permissible concentrations.

document_compliance.amendment_title: Draft Food Safety and Standards (Vegan Foods) Amendment Regulations, 2025
current_practices: The product Healthy Bites is tested for allergens and contains gluten and milk, indicating it is not vegan.
The company maintains a valid FSSAI license and conducts standard lab testing.
evidence: "Allergens: Contains gluten and milk" (Lab Test Report, 10-Aug-2025)
gaps: No evidence that any product meets the vegan criteria defined in the amendment.
Missing labeling or certification that declares a product as vegan.
actions: Identify any vegan product lines and compile ingredient lists confirming absence of animal-derived ingredients.
Obtain third‑party vegan certification or self‑declaration as per amendment guidelines.
Update product labeling to reflect vegan status where applicable.

document_compliance.amendment_title: Draft Notification of Food Safety and Standards
current_practices: NutriFoods Pvt Ltd holds a valid FSSAI license and performs routine lab testing.
The company follows standard regulatory procedures for product safety.
evidence: "All parameters within permissible limits" (Lab Test Report, 10-Aug-2025)
gaps: The notification may contain additional reporting or notification requirements (e.g., recall procedures, adverse event reporting) that are not evidenced in the provided documents.
No evidence of a formal notification system or record of compliance with the notification's procedural mandates.
actions: Review the full text of the notification to identify mandatory reporting obligations.
Implement a notification protocol (e.g., recall, adverse event reporting) and maintain records.
Train relevant staff on notification procedures and conduct periodic audits.

document_compliance.amendment_title: Food Safety and Standards (Labelling and Display) Amendment Regulations, 2025
current_practices: Labelling information such as allergens (gluten, milk) is present in the lab test report.
The company holds a valid FSSAI license and presumably displays standard product information.
evidence: "Allergens: Contains gluten and milk" (Lab Test Report, 10-Aug-2025)
gaps: No evidence of compliance with updated labeling requirements (e.g., nutrition facts, ingredient list, country of origin, expiry date format).
Missing documentation of display practices (e.g., shelf labeling, digital displays).
actions: Audit current product labels for completeness against the amendment's mandatory fields.
Redesign labels to include required information (nutrition facts, ingredient list, allergen declaration, expiry date, batch number).
Update in‑store display materials to meet new visual and informational standards.

document_compliance.amendment_title: Food Safety and Standards (Packaging) First Amendment Regulations, 2025
current_practices: NutriFoods Pvt Ltd uses packaging that is presumably compliant with existing regulations, as implied by the presence of a valid FSSAI license.
The company conducts lab testing to ensure product safety, which may indirectly reflect packaging integrity.
evidence: "All parameters within permissible limits" (Lab Test Report, 10-Aug-2025)
gaps: No evidence of compliance with new packaging material restrictions, labeling on packaging, or environmental sustainability requirements introduced in the amendment.
Missing documentation of packaging material certifications or testing.
actions: Review the amendment to identify mandatory packaging material restrictions and labeling requirements.
Test current packaging materials for compliance with the new standards (e.g., BPA-free, food‑grade plastics).
Update packaging designs and procure certified materials where necessary.
Document and archive packaging compliance certificates.
